Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:41: Those who disbelieve in the Remembrance when it comes to them -- and surely it is a Book Sublime;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:42: falsehood comes not to it from before it nor from behind it; a sending down from One All-wise, All-laudable.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:43: Naught is said to thee but what already was said to the Messengers before thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:44: If We had made it a barbarous Koran, they would have said, ’Why are its signs not distinguished? What, barbarous and Arabic?’ Say: ’To the believers it is a guidance, and a healing; but those who believe not, in their ears is a heaviness, and to them it is a blindness; those -- they are called from a far place.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:45: And We gave Moses the Book; and there was difference concerning it, and but for a Word that preceded from thy Lord, it had been decided between them; and they are in doubt of it disquieting.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:46: Whoso does righteousness, it is to his own gain, and whoso does evil, it is to his own loss.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:47: To Him is referred the knowledge of the Hour.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:48: Then that they called upon before will go astray from them and they will think that they have no asylum.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:49: Man wearies not of praying for good; but when evil visits him, then he is cast down and desperate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:50: And if We let him taste mercy from Us after hardship that has visited him, he surely says, ’This is mine; I think not the Hour is coming.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:51: And when We bless man, he turns away and withdraws aside; but when evil visits him, he is full of endless prayers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:52: Say: ’What think you? If it is from God, then you disbelieve in it, who is further astray than he who is in wide schism?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:53: We shall show them Our signs in the horizons and in themselves, till it is clear to them that it is the truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 41:54: Are they not in doubt touching the encounter with their Lord? Does He not encompass everything? everything?

Muhammad Asad.verse 41:2: THE BESTOWAL from on high [of this revelation] issues from the Most Gracious, the Dispenser of Grace:
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:3: a divine writ, the messages whereof have been clearly spelled out as a discourse in the Arabic tongue for people of
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:5: to be a herald of glad tidings as well as a warning.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:6: and so they say, [as it were:] "Our hearts are veiled from whatever thou callest us to, [O Muhammad,] and in our ears is deafness, and between us and thee is a barrier.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:7: Say thou, [O Prophet:] "I am but a mortal like you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:9: those who do not spend in charity: for it is they, they who
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:10: deny the truth of the life to come!
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:12: verily, they who have attained to faith and do good works shall have a reward unending!
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:13: SAY: "Would you indeed deny Him who has created the earth in two aeons? And do you claim that there is any power that could rival Him, the Sustainer of all the worlds?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:14: For He [it is who, after creating the earth,] placed firm mountains on it,
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:15: above its surface, and bestowed [so many] blessings on it, and equitably apportioned its means of subsistence to all who would seek it: [and all this He created] in four aeons.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:16: And He [it is who] applied His design to the skies, which were [yet but] smoke; and He [it is who] said to them and to the earth, "Come [into being], both of you, willingly or unwillingly!" – to which both responded, "We do come in obedience.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:17: And He [it is who] decreed that they become seven heavens in two aeons, and imparted unto each heaven its function.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:18: BUT IF they turn away, say: "I warn you of [the coming of] a thunderbolt of punishment like the thunderbolt [that fell upon the tribes] of ’ād and Thamūd!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:20: apostles, speaking of what lay open before them and what was
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:21: beyond their ken, [and calling unto them,] "Worship none but God!" They answered: "If our Sustainer had willed [us to believe in what you say], He would have sent down angels [as His message-bearers].
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:22: Now as for [the tribe of] ’ād, they walked arrogantly on earth,
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:23: against all right, and saying, "Who could have a power greater than ours?" Why – were they, then, not aware that God, who created them, had a power greater than theirs? But they went on rejecting Our messages;
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:24: and thereupon We let loose upon them a stormwind raging through days of misfortune, so as to give them, in the life of this world, a foretaste of suffering through humiliation: but
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:25: suffering in the life to come will be far more humiliating, and they will have none to succour them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:26: And as for [the tribe of] Thamūd, We offered them guidance, but they chose blindness in preference to guidance: and so the thunderbolt of shameful suffering fell upon them as an outcome of all [the evil] that they had wrought;
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:28: those who had attained to faith and were conscious of Us.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:29: Hence, [warn all men of] the Day when the enemies of God shall be gathered together before the fire, and then shall be driven onward,
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:30: till, when they come close to it, their hearing and their sight and their
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:31: skins will bear witness against them, speaking of what they were doing [on earth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:32: And they will ask their skins, "Why did you bear witness against us?" –
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:33: these will reply: "God, who gives speech to all things, has given speech to us [as well]: for He [it is who] has created you in the first instance – and unto Him you are
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:35: And you did not try to hide [your sins] lest your hearing or your sight or your skins bear witness against you: nay, but you thought that God did not know much of what you were doing –
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:36: and that very thought which you thought about your Sustainer has brought you to perdition, and so now you find yourselves among the lost!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:38: if they endure [their lot] in patience, the fire will still be their abode; and if they pray to be allowed to make amends, they will not be allowed to do so:
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:39: for [when they became oblivious of Us,] We assigned to them [their own evil impulses as their] other selves, and these made appear goodly to them whatever lay open before them and whatever was beyond their ken.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:41: NOW THOSE who are bent on denying the truth say [unto one another]: "Do not listen to this Qur’ān, but rather talk frivolously about it, so that you might gain the upper hand!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:42: But We shall most certainly give those who are
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:43: bent on denying the truth a taste of suffering severe, and We shall most certainly requite them according to the worst of their deeds!
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:44: That requital of God’s enemies will be the fire [of the hereafter]: in it will they have an abode of immeasurable duration as an outcome of their having knowingly rejected Our messages.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:45: And they who [in their life on earth] were bent on denying the truth will
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:46: exclaim: "O our Sustainer! Show us those of the invisible beings and humans that have led us astray: we shall trample them underfoot, so that they shall be the lowest of all!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:48: behold, as for those who say, "Our Sustainer is God," and then steadfastly pursue the right way – upon them do angels often descend,
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:49: "Fear not and grieve not, but receive the glad tiding of that paradise which has been promised to you!
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:50: We are close unto you in the life of this world and [will be so] in the life to come; and in that [life to come] you shall have all that your souls may desire, and in it you shall have all that you ever prayed for,
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:51: as a ready welcome from Him who is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:52: And who could be better of speech than he who calls [his fellow-men] unto God, and does what is just and right, and says, "Verily, I am of those who have surrendered themselves to God"?
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:54: good and evil cannot be equal, repel thou
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:55: with something that is better – and lo! he between whom and thyself was enmity [may then become] as though he had
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:56: been close [unto thee], a true friend!
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:57: Yet [to achieve] this is not given to any but those who are wont to be patient in adversity: it is not given to any but those endowed with the greatest good fortune!
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:58: Hence, if it should happen that a prompting from Satan stirs thee up [to blind anger], seek refuge with God: behold, He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing!
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:59: Now among His signs are the night and the day, as well as the sun and the moon:
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:60: adore not the sun or the moon, but prostrate yourselves in adoration before God, who has created them – if it is Him whom you
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:62: And though some be too proud [to listen to this call], they who [in their hearts] are with thy Sustainer extol His limitless glory by night and by day, and never grow weary .
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:63: For among His signs is this: thou seest the earth lying desolate – and lo! when We send down water upon it, it stirs and swells [with life]! Verily, He who brings it to life can surely give life to the dead [of heart as well]: for, behold, He has the power to will anything.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:64: VERILY, they who distort the meaning of Our messages are not hidden from Us: hence, which [of the two] will be in a better state – he that is [destined to be] cast into the fire, or he that shall come secure [before Us] on Resurrection Day? Do what you will: verily, He sees all that you do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:65: Verily, they who are bent on denying the truth of this reminder as soon as it comes to them – [they are the losers]: for, behold, it is a sublime divine writ:
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:66: no falsehood can ever attain to it openly, and neither in a stealthy manner, [since it is] bestowed from on high by One who is truly wise, ever to be praised.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:67: [And as for thee, O Prophet,] nothing is being said to thee but what was said to all [of God’s] apostles before thy time.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:68: Now if We had willed this [divine writ] to be a discourse in a non-Arabic tongue, they [who now reject it] would surely have said, "Why is it that its messages have not been spelled out clearly? Why – [a message in] a non-Arabic tongue, and [its bearer] an Arab?" Say: "Unto all who have attained to faith, this [divine writ] is a guidance and a source of health; but as for those who will not believe – in their ears is deafness, and so it remains obscure to them: they are [like people who are] being called from too far away.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:69: Thus, too, have We vouchsafed revelation unto Moses aforetime, and thereupon disputes arose about it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:70: WHOEVER does what is just and right, does so for his own good; and whoever does evil, does so to his own hurt: and never does God do the least wrong to His creatures.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:71: In Him alone is vested the knowledge of when the Last Hour will come.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:73: answer, "We confess unto Thee that none of us can bear witness [to anyone’s having a share in Thy divinity]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:74: And so, all that they were wont to invoke aforetime will have forsaken them; and they shall know for certain that there is no escape for them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:75: MAN NEVER TIRES of asking for the good [things of life]; and if evil fortune touches him, he abandons all hope, giving himself up to despair.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:76: Yet whenever We let him taste some of Our grace after hardship has visited him, he is sure to say, "This is but my due!" – and, "I do not think that the Last Hour will ever come: but if [it should come, and] I should indeed be brought back unto my Sustainer, then, behold, the ultimate good awaits me with Him!" But [on the Day of Judgment] We shall most certainly give those who were bent on denying the truth full understanding of all that they ever did, and shall most certainly give them
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:78: And, too, when We bestow Our blessings upon man, he tends to turn aside and keep aloof [from remembering Us]; but as soon as evil fortune touches him, he is full of wordy prayers!
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:79: HAVE YOU given thought [to how you will fare] if this be truly [a revelation] from God, the while you deny its truth? Who could be more astray than one who places himself
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:81: In time We shall make them fully understand Our messages [through what they perceive] in the utmost horizons [of the universe] and within themselves, so that it will become clear unto them that this
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:83: is it not enough [for them to know] that thy Sustainer is witness unto everything?
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:84: Oh, verily, they are in doubt as to whether they will meet their Sustainer [on Judgment Day]! Oh, verily, He encompasses everything!
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:85: knowledge” mentioned in the preceding verse are obviously those who understand the spiritual purport of this divine writ and, therefore, submit to its guidance: hence, it cannot be “most of them” who are referred to in the above phrase and in the next verse, but, on the contrary, people who are devoid of such knowledge and to whom, in consequence, the Qur’ān is meaningless.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:87: with something that is better” relates to scurrilous objections to, and hostile criticism of, the Qur’ān.
Muhammad Asad.verse 41:88: will be blind in the life to come [as well].

Martin Lings.verse 41:1: Verily those who say: “Our Lord is God”, and who then follow straight His path, on them descend the Angels saying: “Fear not nor grieve, but hearken to good tidings of the Paradise which ye are promised”.
Martin Lings.verse 41:2: “We are your protecting friends in this lower life, and in the Hereafter wherein ye shall be given that which your souls long for, that which ye pray for.
Martin Lings.verse 41:3: “In bounty from Him who is All-Forgiving, All-Merciful”.
Martin Lings.verse 41:4: …none meeteth it face to face save him whose destined portion is immeasurably blessed.
Martin Lings.verse 41:5: And of His signs are the night and the day and the sun and the moon.
Martin Lings.verse 41:6: We shall show them Our signs upon the horizons and within themselves, until it be clear to them that He is the truth.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:2: This is a revelation from the All-Merciful, the Very-Merciful-
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:3: - a book whose verses are elaborated in the form of an Arabic Qur’ān for a people who understand,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:4: as a bearer of good news and warning.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:5: And they say, “Our hearts are (wrapped) in covers against that (faith) to which you invite us, and there is deafness in our ears, and there is a barrier between you and us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:6: Say, “I am but a human being like you; it is revealed to me that your god is only One God.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:7: who do not pay Zakāh ; and of the life of the Hereafter, they are deniers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:8: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for them there is a reward that will never be interrupted.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:9: Say, “Do you really disbelieve in the One who has created the earth in two days, and ascribe to Him partners? That is the Lord of the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:10: He has placed firm mountains in it (the earth) towering above it, and put blessings in it, and proportioned its foods therein, in four days, equal for those who ask.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:11: Then He turned straight to the sky, while it was a smoke, and said to it and to the earth, “Come (to My obedience), both of you, willingly or unwillingly.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:12: So He accomplished them as seven skies in two days, and settled in every sky its (due) thing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:13: So, if they turn away, then say, “I have warned you of a calamity like the calamity of ‘Ād and Thamūd,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:14: when the messengers came to them from their front and from their rear, saying, “Do not worship anyone but Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:15: As for ‘Ād, they showed arrogance in the land with no right (to do so), and said, “Who is stronger than us in power?” Did they not see that Allah, who created them, is stronger than them in power? And they used to reject Our signs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:16: So, We let loose a wild wind on them in unlucky days to make them taste the humiliating punishment in the present life.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:17: As for Thamūd, We showed them the way, but they preferred blindness to the guidance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:18: And We saved those who believed and used to be God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:19: (Remind them of) the day when Allah’s enemies will be mustered towards the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:20: until when they will come to it, their ears and their eyes and their skins will testify against them about what they used to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:21: And they will say to their skins, “Why did you testify against us?” They (the skins) will say, “We were made to speak by Allah, the One who has made every thing to speak.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:22: And you had not been hiding your selves (when committing sins) from your ears and your eyes and your skins that would bear witness against you, but you thought that Allah did not know much of what you did.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:23: This thought of yours that you conceived about your Lord brought you to ruin, and you became among the losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:24: Now, if they endure patiently, even then the Fire is their abode, and if they seek forgiveness, they are not among those (who could be) forgiven.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:25: And We had assigned for them fellows (in the worldly life) who beautified for them what was before them and what was behind them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:26: And said those who disbelieved, “Do not listen to this Qur’ān, and make noise during its recitation, so that you may overcome.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:27: So, We will certainly make them taste a severe punishment, and will certainly recompense them for the worst of what they used to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:28: That is the recompense of the enemies of Allah- the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:29: And those who disbelieve will say, “Our Lord, show us the two, out of the Jinns and the humans, who led us astray and we will put both of them under our feet, so that they become among the lowest.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:30: Surely, those who have declared: “Our Lord is Allah”, then remained steadfast, on them the angels will descend, saying, “Do not fear, and do not grieve; and be happy with the good news of the Jannah (Paradise) that you had been promised.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:31: We have been your friends in the worldly life, and (will remain as such) in the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:32: - a gift of welcome from the Most-forgiving, the Very-Merciful”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:33: Who can be better in words than the one who calls towards Allah, and acts righteously and says, “I am one of those who submit themselves (to Allah)”?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:34: Good and evil are not equal.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:35: And no one is blessed with this (attitude) but those who observe patience, and no one is blessed with this (attitude) but a man of great luck.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:36: And should a stroke from ShaiTān (Satan) strike you, seek refuge with Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:37: Among His signs are the night and the day, and the sun and the moon.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:38: Still, if they show arrogance, then those who are with your Lord proclaim His purity night and day, and they do not get weary.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:39: And among His signs is that you see the land inactive; then, once We send down water thereto, it gets excited and swells.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:40: Surely those who adopt perversity about Our verses are not hidden from Us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:41: Surely those who have rejected the advice (the Qur’ān) when it came to them (are the ones who adopted perversity, and are not hidden from Us).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:42: that cannot be approached by falsehood, neither from its front, nor from its behind -a revelation from the All-Wise, the Ever-Praised.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:43: Nothing is being said to you but what has been said to the messengers before you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:44: Had We made it a non-Arabic Qur’ān, they would have said, “Why are its verses not clearly explained? Is it a non-Arabic (book) and an Arab (messenger)?” Say, “For those who believe, it is guidance and cure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:45: And We gave Mūsā the book, then it was disputed (as well).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:46: If someone acts righteously, he does so for the benefit of his own soul, and if someone commits evil, he does so against it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:47: To Him alone the knowledge of the Hour (the exact time of Doomsday) is to be referred.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:48: And whatever they used to invoke earlier will vanish from them, and they will realize that they have no way to escape.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:49: Man does not get weary of craving for (all sorts of ) good things; and if he is touched by some evil, he is disappointed, devoid of any hope.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:50: And if We give him a taste of some mercy from Us after some hardship that has touched him, he will surely say, “This is my right.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:51: When We bestow Our favor upon man, he avoids (to appreciate it) and keeps himself far aside (from obedience), and when some evil touches him, he is full of lengthy prayers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:52: Say (to the disbelievers), “Tell me, if it (the Qur’ān) is from Allah, and still you reject it, then who can be more erroneous than him who is (involved) in far reaching schism?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:53: We will show them Our signs in the universe and within their own beings until it will become manifest to them that it is the truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 41:54: Beware, they are in doubt about meeting their Lord.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:2: (It is) sent down from the Most Kind (Lord), the Ever-Merciful,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:3: A Book whose signs are expounded in detail, the Qur’an, in the Arabic (language) for a people who possess knowledge and wisdom,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:4: A Bearer of good news and a Warner.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:5: And they say: ‘Our hearts are in covers against that to which you call us, and in our ears is heaviness (of deafness), and between us and you is a barrier.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:6: (To remove their barrier and to inspire them to listen,) say: ‘(O disbelievers!) Well, being a human outwardly, I am like you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:7: Those who do not pay Zakat (the Alms-due), and it is they who deny the Hereafter as well.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:8: Surely, those who believe and do righteous works persistently, for them is endless reward.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:9: Say: ‘Do you deny Him (Allah) Who created the earth in two days (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:10: And He placed over it heavy mountains (brought forth) from within it and treasured in it (His infinite) blessings (minerals, water reservoirs, natural resources and other substances and forces and energies) and provided and appointed in it sustenance (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:11: Then He turned towards the heavenly universe—that was (all) smoke.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:12: Then He made seven heavens in two days (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:13: Then if they turn away, say: ‘I warn you of a terrible torment like the destruction of ‘Ad and Thamud.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:14: When the Messengers came to them from their front and from their rear (or before them and after them and said:) ‘Worship none but Allah,’ they said: ‘Had our Lord willed, He would have sent down angels.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:15: As for the people of ‘Ad, they were unrightfully arrogant (and rebellious) in the land and said: ‘Who is greater in might than we are?’ And have they not seen that Allah, Who has created them, is far mightier in power than they are? And they kept denying Our Revelations.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:16: So We sent upon them an appalling and violent wind during ill-omened days to make them taste the torment of humiliation in the worldly life, and the torment of the Hereafter will be far more degrading.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:17: And as for the people of Thamud, We showed them the path of guidance, but they preferred blindness to guidance.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:18: And We delivered those who believed and performed acts of piety (and self-protection).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:19: And the Day when the enemies of Allah will be gathered and driven to Hell, they will be impeded (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:20: Until, when they reach Hell, their ears, their eyes and their skins will bear witness against them concerning the works that they used to do.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:21: Then they will say to their skins: ‘Why did you bear witness against us?’ They will say: ‘Allah, Who gives speech to everything, has enabled us to speak.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:22: (Whilst committing the sin) you did not take any cover even against this (fear) that your ears would bear witness against you and (that) your eyes and (that) your skins (might even bear witness), but you imagined that even Allah did not know many of the deeds that you do.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:23: And it is this notion that you developed about your Lord which ruined you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:24: Now even if they keep patience, their abode is Hell; and if they seek to earn (Allah’s) pleasure (by turning to Him in repentance), even then they will not be amongst those who attain to Allah’s pleasure.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:25: And We appointed for them companions (satans).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:26: And the disbelievers say: ‘Do not listen to this Qur’an, but make noises in (its recitation sessions), so that you may overwhelm (their recitation from the Qur’an).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:27: So We will most certainly make the disbelievers taste the severe torment, and will most certainly requite them for the evil deeds which they used to do.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:28: This Hell is the recompense of the enemies of Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:29: And those who disbelieved will say: ‘O our Lord, show us those of the jinn and men who led us astray, so that we may (crush) them under our feet, and so that they may become of the most humiliated ones.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:30: Surely, those who say: ‘Our Lord is Allah,’ then stick to it (firmly), angels descend upon them (and say:) ‘Do not fear or grieve, and rejoice in the Paradise that you were promised.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:31: We are your friends and helpers in the life of this world and in the Hereafter (too).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:32: (This) is hospitality from the Most Forgiving, Ever-Merciful (Lord).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:33: And who can be more pleasing in speech than one who calls towards Allah and does pious work and says: ‘Surely, I am of the obedient servants (of Allah and the Holy Prophet)’?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:34: And good and evil cannot be equal.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:35: And this (virtue) is granted only to those who observe patience.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:36: And, (O believing servant,) if an evil whisper of Satan stirs your mind, seek refuge with Allah; surely, He is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:37: And of His signs are the night and the day and the sun and the moon.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:38: Then if they show arrogance (do not care for them).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:39: And of His signs is also that you (first) see the earth dry (and worthless), but when We rain water on it, it becomes green and fresh and brings forth vegetation.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:40: Verily, those who turn away from the straight path with regard to (the meanings of) Our Verses are not hidden from Us.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:41: Indeed, those who disbelieved in the Qur’an when it had come to them, (that is their ill fortune).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:42: Falsehood can approach it (the Qur’an) neither from before nor from behind.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:43: (O Beloved!) Whatever is said to you are the same words that have been said to the Messengers before you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:44: And if We had revealed this (Book) as a Qur’an in a non-Arabic language, they would certainly have said: ‘Why have its Verses not been expounded expressly? Is the Book non-Arabic and the Prophet an Arab?’ (So, O Esteemed Beloved, We have revealed the Qur’an also in your language.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:45: And verily, We gave the Book to Musa (Moses), but disagreement was perpetrated in that (too).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:46: Whoever does pious work does it for (the benefit) of his own self, and whoever commits sin, its (resultant evil suffering) will fall back on him alone.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:47: The knowledge of the Hour of Resurrection is referred to Him (Allah) alone.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:48: And all those (idols) that they used to worship will disappear from them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:49: Man does not tire of praying for good, and if an evil touches him, he loses all hope—becomes a pessimist.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:50: And if We give him a taste of mercy from Us after that misery which touched him, he surely starts saying: ‘This is my privilege.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:51: And when We bestow a favour upon man, he turns his face away and, keeping withdrawn, strides far from Us.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:52: Say: ‘Well, give your view, if this (Qur’an) is really (sent down) from Allah and you keep denying it, then who is more astray than he who is (engaged) in extreme opposition?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:53: We will soon show them Our signs all around the world and in their own selves, until it dawns on them that indeed this is the truth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 41:54: Beware that they are in doubt about the meeting with their Lord.

null.verse 41:11: Sitten tuli vuoro taivaan, joka oli pelkkää usvaa, ja Hän sanoi sille sekä maalle: »Tulkaa esiin kumpikin, suosiolla tai vastahakoisesti.
null.verse 41:12: Niin Hän järjesti ne kahdessa päivässä seitsemäksi taivaaksi ja ilmoitti kullekin taivaalle sen tehtävän.
null.verse 41:13: Mutta jos he kääntyvät pois, sano: »Olen varoittanut teitä kurituksesta, sellaisesta rangaistuksesta kuin Aadin ja Tamuudin.
null.verse 41:14: Kun näille lähetetyt sananjulistajat tulivat heidän luokseen sekä edestä että takaa sanoen: »Älkää palkelko muuta kuin Jumalaa!» niin he sanoivat: »Jos Herramme olisi tahtonut, Hän olisi varmasti lähettänyt alas enkelinsä; niinpä emme totisesti usko sanomaa, joka on lähetetty teidän mukananne.
null.verse 41:15: Aadin kansa pöyhkeili suotta ja sanoi: »Kuka on meitä mahtavampi?» Eivätkö he havainneet, että Jumala, joka heidät oli luonut, oli heitä mahtavampi? Ja he kielsivät ilmoituksemme.
null.verse 41:16: Niin Me lähetimme raivoisan tuulen heidän ylitseen useana onnettomuutta tuottavana päivänä antaaksemme heidän maistaa häpeällistä rangaistusta maallisessa elämässä.
null.verse 41:17: Mitä tulee Tamuudiin, osoitimme heille oikean tien, mutta he valitsivat harhan välittämättä johdatuksesta.
null.verse 41:18: Mutta niitä armahdimme, jotka kavahtivat pahaa ja uskoivat.
null.verse 41:19: Sinä päivänä, jolloin Jumalan viholliset kootaan tulen eteen, heidät jaetaan ryhmiin.
null.verse 41:20: Ja kun he saapuvat sinne, heidän silmänsä, korvansa ja ihonsa todistavat heitä vastaan siitä, mitä he ovat tehneet.
null.verse 41:21: Ja he sanovat iholle: »Miksi todistat meitä vastaan»? Tämä sanoo: »Jumala, joka antaa kaikille ilmaisukyvyn, on pannut minut puhumaan; Hän on alussa luonut teidät, ja Hänen tykönsä joudutte palaamaan.
null.verse 41:22: Te ette voineet niin kätkeytyä, etteivät korvanne, silmänne ja ihonne todistaneet teitä vastaan, vaikka ajattelitte, että Jumalalle oli tuntematonta suuri osa siitä, minkä te teitte.
null.verse 41:23: Tämä ajatus Herrastanne on syössyt teidät kadotukseen, ja teistä on tullut turmion omia.
null.verse 41:24: Jos he kestävät, pysyy tuli yhä heidän asuntonaan, ja jos he anovat armoa, eivät he niihin kuulu, joille armoa suodaan.
null.verse 41:25: Me olemme määrännyt heille seuralaisia, jotka kuvailivat kauniiksi sen, mikä odotti heitä, ja myös sen, mikä heillä oli takanaan.
null.verse 41:26: Ja ne, jotka eivät usko, sanovat: »Alkää kuunnelko tämän Koraanin lukemista, vaan pitäkää melua; ehkä pääsette voitolle.
null.verse 41:27: Sentähden Me totisesti annamme uskottomien maistaa ankaraa kuritusta ja totisesti annamme heille palkan pahoista töistä, joita he tekivät.
null.verse 41:28: Jumalan vihollisten palkka on tuli; se on oleva heidän asuntonaan ikuisesti, palkaksi siitä, että he kielsivät Meidän ilmoituksemme.
null.verse 41:29: Ja ne, jotka eivät usko, sanovat: »Herra, osoita meille dzinnien ja ihmisten joukosta ne, jotka johtivat meidät harhaan, jotta saattaisimme polkea heidät jalkoihimme, niin että he alimpaan paikkaan joutuisivat.
null.verse 41:30: Niiden luokse, jotka sanovat: »Jumala on Herramme» ja pysyvät oikealla tiellä, laskeutuvat enkelit sanoen: »Alkää pelätkö älkääkä olko murheissanne, vaan ottakaa vastaan ilosanoma paratiisista, joka teille on luvattu.
null.verse 41:31: Me olemme teidän suojelijanne sekä tämän maailman elämässä että sitä seuraavassa; siinä olette saavat mitä pyydätte ja mitä sielunne halajaa.
null.verse 41:32: Lahjaksi Häneltä, joka on anteeksiantava, armahtava.
null.verse 41:33: Ken puhuu paremmin kuin se, joka kutsuu muita Jumalan luokse, tekee hyvää ja sanoo: »Totisesti olen Jumalalle alamainen»?
null.verse 41:34: Hyvä ja paha eivät ole samanlaisia.
null.verse 41:35: Mutta sen saavuttavat vain pitkämieliset; sen saavat vain ne, joiden osana on suuri onni.
null.verse 41:36: Ja jos Saatana sinua tahtoisi johtaa kiusaukseen, turvaudu Jumalaan; totisesti, Hän on kuuleva, kaikkitietävä.
null.verse 41:37: Hänen tunnusmerkkejään ovat yö ja päivä, aurinko ja kuu.
null.verse 41:38: Mutta jos he osoittautuvat ylpeiksi, niin kyllä ne, jotka ovat Herrasi luona, ylistävät Häntä päivin ja öin, väsymättä.
null.verse 41:39: Hänen merkkejään on sekin, että näette maan kuivuneena, mutta kun Me lähetämme sille vettä, se saa elon ja kasvuvoiman; totisesti Hän, joka antaa sille elon, on antava elämän kuolleille, totisesti Hänellä on valta kaiken yli.
null.verse 41:40: Totisesti eivät ne, jotka poikkeavat oikealta tieltä kieltäen ilmoituksemme, pääse Meiltä piiloon.
null.verse 41:41: näkee ne, jotka eivät usko varoitukseen, kun se tulee heidän luokseen.
null.verse 41:42: valhe ei siihen ylety, ei edestä eikä takaa; se on sanoma viisaalta, ylistetyltä.
null.verse 41:43: Sinulle ei sanota mitään muuta, kuin mitä sanottiin jo sananjulistajille ennen sinua; Herrasi voi anteeksi antaa, mutta myös ankarasti rangaista.
null.verse 41:44: Jos Me olisimme tehnyt siitä vieraskielisen Koraanin, niin olisivat he varmasti sanoneet: »Miksi hänen merkkinsä eivät ole selviä? Vierastako kieltä arabialaiselle?» Sano: »Se on niille, jotka uskovat, ojennus ja parannus.
null.verse 41:45: Totisesti, Me annoimme Moosekselle Kirjoituksen, mutta siitä on kiistelty.
null.verse 41:46: Kuka tahansa tekee hyvää, sille se koituu hänen oman sielunsa hyväksi, ja kuka pahaa tekee, sille koituu se hänen sielunsa vahingoksi.
null.verse 41:47: Hänestä riippuu hetki, ja Hän sen tietää.
null.verse 41:48: Ja ne, joita he ennen kumarsivat, häipyvät heiltä, ja he huomaavat, ettei heillä ole pelastuksen mahdollisuutta.
null.verse 41:49: Ihminen ei milloinkaan väsy pyytämään hyvää, mutta jos paha kohtaa häntä, joutuu hän epätoivon valtaan.
null.verse 41:50: Mutta jos Me annamme hänen kokea armoamme ahdistuksen jälkeen, hän sanoo varmasti: »Tämä on minulle kuuluvaa, enkä usko tuomion päivään; mutta jos minut lähetetään takaisin Herrani luo, olen Hänen luonaan varmasti kokeva hyvää.
null.verse 41:51: Kun Me osoitamme suosiota ihmiselle, hän kääntyy pois ja etääntyy, mutta kun vastoinkäyminen kohtaa häntä, hänen rukouksensa ovat pitkät ja nöyrät.
null.verse 41:52: Sano: »Katso, jos se on Jumalalta, te kiellätte sen; kuka erehtyy enemmän kuin se, joka näin kauaksi harhautuu?»
null.verse 41:53: Me osoitamme heille pian merkkimme sekä kaukaisilla seuduilla että heidän oman kansansa keskuudessa, kunnes totuus kirkastuu heille kokonaan.
null.verse 41:54: Toden totta, he epäilevät joutumistaan Herransa eteen, mutta Hän totisesti ohjaa maailman menoa.

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:2: C'est une révélation du Miséricordieux, du Clément
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:3: C'est un Livre dont les versets sont clairement exposés, un Coran arabe destiné à instruire les hommes,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:4: une bonne nouvelle et un avertissement.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:5: Ils disent : " Nos cœurs sont fermés à ce vers quoi tu nous appelles ; nos oreilles sont bouchées, et entre nous et toi est tendu un voile.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:6: Dis : " Je ne suis qu'un mortel semblable à vous.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:7: ceux qui ne font pas l'aumône et qui nient la vie future.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:8: Assurément, ceux qui croient et qui accomplissent des œuvres pies recevront une récompense sans limite.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:9: Dis : " Refuserez-vous de croire en Celui qui a créé la terre en deux jours, et Lui donnerez-vous des émules ? C'est Lui, le Seigneur des mondes ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:10: Il a établi sur la terre des montagnes qui la surplombent.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:11: Il s'est ensuite tourné vers le ciel, qui était une fumée, et Il lui a dit ainsi qu'à la terre : " Venez tous deux, de gré ou de force ! " Ils dirent : " Nous venons de plein gré ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:12: Il a établi sept cieux en deux jours et Il a révélé à chaque ciel ce qui le concerne.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:13: S'ils se détournent, dis-leur : " Je vous ai menacés d'une foudre semblable à celle qui a frappé les 'Ad et les Thamoud ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:14: Lorsque les envoyés sont venus à eux et leur ont crié, par devant et par derrière : " N'adorez que Dieu ! ", ils ont rétorqué : " Si notre Seigneur l'avait voulu, Il aurait fait descendre des anges ; mais nous, nous ne croyons pas à ce avec quoi vous avez été envoyés ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:15: Quant aux 'Ad, ils se sont injustement enorgueillis sur la terre, disant : " Qui donc est plus redoutable que nous par la force ? " N'ont-ils pas vu que Dieu, qui les a créés, est plus redoutable qu'eux par la force ? Et voilà qu'ils ont nié Nos signes !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:16: Nous envoyâmes contre eux un vent impétueux durant des jours néfastes, pour leur faire goûter le châtiment de l'ignominie dans la vie de ce monde.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:17: Quant aux Thamoud, Nous les avons dirigés ; mais ils ont préféré l'aveuglement à la bonne direction.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:18: Nous avons sauvé ceux qui croyaient et qui Nous craignaient.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:19: Le Jour où les ennemis de Dieu seront rassemblés pour être conduits dans le Feu, ils iront par groupes.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:20: Quand ils y parviendront, leurs oreilles, leurs yeux et leur peau témoigneront contre eux de leurs agissements.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:21: Ils diront à leur peau : " Pourquoi as-tu témoigné contre nous ? " Elle répondra : " Dieu nous a fait parler, Lui qui a donné la parole à toute chose, Lui qui vous a créés une première fois et vers Qui vous serez ramenés ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:22: Vous ne pouviez vous cacher au point que ni vos oreilles, ni vos yeux, ni votre peau ne puissent témoigner contre vous, et vous avez pensé que Dieu ignore une bonne partie de vos actions.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:23: Telle était la pensée que vous nourrissiez à l'égard de votre Seigneur : elle vous a ruinés et vous vous êtes retrouvés parmi les perdants.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:24: Même s'ils font preuve de résignation, le Feu sera leur demeure.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:25: Nous leur avons assigné des compagnons qui ont enjolivé à leurs yeux ce qui se trouvait devant eux et derrière eux.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:26: Les mécréants disent : " N'écoutez pas ce Coran, mais couvrez-le de vos voix ; peut-être aurez-vous le dessus ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:27: Nous ferons goûter aux mécréants un châtiment rigoureux et Nous les rétribuerons pour ce qu'ils auront commis de pire.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:28: Telle est la rétribution des ennemis de Dieu : le Feu.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:29: Les mécréants disent : " Notre Seigneur ! Montre-nous, parmi les djinns et les hommes, les deux êtres qui nous ont égarés ; nous les mettrons sous nos talons pour qu'ils soient foncièrement avilis.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:30: En vérité, ceux qui s'écrient : " Notre Seigneur est Dieu ! " et qui persévèrent dans la rectitude, les anges descendent sur eux, disant : " N'ayez crainte, ne vous affligez pas, mais accueillez avec joie la bonne nouvelle du Paradis qui vous a été promis.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:31: Nous sommes vos protecteurs dans la vie de ce monde et dans la vie future.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:32: comme un don de bienvenue de la part de Celui qui pardonne, qui est clément.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:33: Qui donc prononce de plus belles paroles que celui qui implore Dieu, agit vertueusement et s'écrie : " Certes, je suis de ceux qui sont soumis [à la Volonté divine = muslimûn] " ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:34: L'action bonne n'est pas semblable à la mauvaise.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:35: C'est là une chose à laquelle n'atteignent que ceux qui exercent la patience, ceux qui ont reçu une faveur insigne.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:36: Si en quelque occasion le Démon t'incite à la discorde, cherche refuge en Dieu ; Il est Celui qui entend tout, l'Omniscient.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:37: Parmi Ses signes il y a la nuit et le jour, le soleil et la lune.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:38: D'aucuns peuvent se montrer orgueilleux, mais ceux qui sont proches de leur Seigneur célèbrent Ses louanges nuit et jour, sans jamais se lasser.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:39: C'est un de Ses signes que tu voies la terre nue et désolée ; mais lorsque Nous faisons descendre sur elle l'eau du ciel, elle se ranime et redevient féconde.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:40: Ceux qui altèrent le sens de Nos signes ne sauraient se cacher de Nous.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:41: Il est des gens qui nient le Rappel lorsqu'il leur parvient.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:42: L'erreur ne peut l'atteindre ; c'est une Révélation d'un Seigneur sage et digne de louange.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:43: Tout ce qui t'est dit, sans exception, est cela même qui a déjà été dit aux envoyés venus avant toi.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:44: Si Nous en avions fait un Coran récité dans une langue étrangère, ils auraient dit : " Si au moins ses versets avaient été clairement exposés ! Et pourquoi une langue étrangère et un
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:45: Arabe ? " Dis : " Il est pour les croyants une guidance et une guérison.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:46: Nous avons donné à Moïse le Livre, mais celui-ci a suscité des controverses.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:47: Quiconque fait le bien le fait pour lui-même, et quiconque fait le mal le fait contre luimême.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:48: C'est à Lui qu'appartient la connaissance de l'Heure.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:49: Ce qu'ils imploraient auparavant les abandonnera, et ils sentiront alors qu'ils n'ont pas d'échappatoire.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:50: L'homme ne se lasse pas d'appeler le bonheur, et si le malheur le touche le voilà désespéré et désemparé.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:51: Et si Nous lui faisons goûter quelque miséricorde venue de Nous après qu'un malheur l'a atteint, il s'écrie : " Ceci m'est bien dû ! Je ne pense pas que l'Heure va venir, mais si je suis ramené vers mon Seigneur, je jouirai auprès de Lui de la plus belle récompense ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:52: Lorsque Nous comblons l'homme de bienfaits, il se détourne et part de son côté.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:53: Dis : " Ne voyez-vous pas [la gravité de votre erreur] si ceci provient de Dieu et que vous n'y croyez pas ? Qui donc est plus égaré que celui qui s'éloigne dans la dissidence ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:54: Nous leur montrerons Nos signes dans les horizons et en eux-mêmes, jusqu'à ce qu'il leur apparaisse avec évidence que ceci est la Vérité.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 41:55: Comment peuvent-ils mettre en doute la rencontre avec leur Seigneur ? Lui n'embrasset- il pas toute chose de Sa science ?

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:3: une Révélation descendue de la part du Tout Miséricordieux, du Très Miséricordieux.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:4: Un Livre dont les versets sont détaillés (et clairement exposés), un Coran
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:5: arabe pour des gens qui savent,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:7: Et ils diront : «Nos coeurs sont voilés contre ce à quoi tu nous appelles, nos oreilles sont sourdes.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:8: Dis : «Je ne suis qu’un homme comme vous.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:9: qui n’acquittent pas la Zakat et ne croient pas en l’au-delà !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:10: Ceux qui croient et accomplissent de bonnes oeuvres auront une énorme récompense jamais interrompue.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:12: de celui qui a créé la terre en deux jours, et Lui donnerez-vous des égaux ? Tel est le Seigneur de l’univers,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:13: C’est Lui qui fermement fixé des montagnes au-dessus d’elle, l’a bénie, et lui assigna ses ressources alimentaires en quatre jours d’égale durée.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:14: Il S’est ensuite adressé au ciel qui était alors fumée et lui dit, ainsi qu’à la terre : «Venez tous deux, bon gré, mal gré».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:15: Il décréta d’en faire sept cieux en deux jours et révéla à chaque ciel sa fonction .
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:17: S’ils s’en détournent, alors dis-leur; «Je vous ai avertis d’une foudre semblable à celle qui frappa les Aad et les Tamud».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:18: Quand les Messagers leur étaient venus, de devant eux et par derrière , [leur disant]: «N’adorez que Dieu», ils dirent : «Si notre Seigneur avait voulu, Il aurait certainement fait descendre des Anges.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:19: Quant aux Aad, ils s’enflèrent d’orgueil sur terre injustement, et dirent : «Qui est plus fort que nous ? » Quoi ! N’ont-ils pas vu qu’en vérité Dieu qui les a créés est plus fort qu’eux ? Et ils reniaient Nos signes.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:20: Nous déchaînâmes contre eux un vent violent et glacial en des jours néfastes, afin de leur faire goûter le châtiment de l’ignominie dans la vie présente.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:21: Et quant aux Tamud, Nous les guidâmes; mais ils ont préféré l’aveuglement à la guidée.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:22: Et Nous sauvâmes ceux qui croyaient et craignaient Dieu.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:23: Et le jour où les ennemis de Dieu seront rassemblés en masse vers le Feu.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:24: Alors, quant ils y seront, leur ouïe, leurs yeux et leurs peaux témoigneront contre eux de ce qu’ils oeuvraient.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:25: Ils diront à leur peaux : «Pourquoi avez-vous témoigné contre nous ? » Elles diront : «C’est Dieu qui nous a fait parler, Lui qui fait parler toute chose.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:26: Vous ne pouvez vous cacher au point que ni votre ouïe, ni vos yeux et ni vos peaux ne puissent témoigner contre vous.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:27: Et c’est cette pensée que vous avez eue de votre Seigneur, qui vous a ruinés, de sorte que vous êtes devenus du nombre des perdants.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:28: S’ils endurent, le Feu sera leur lieu de séjour; et s’ils cherchent à s’excuser, ils ne seront pas excusés.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:29: Et Nous leur avons destiné des compagnons inséparables [des démons] qui leur ont enjolivé ce qui était devant et derrière eux .
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:30: Et ceux qui avaient mécru dirent : «Ne prêtez pas l’oreille à ce Coran, et faites du chahut (pendant sa récitation) afin d’avoir le dessus».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:31: Nous ferons certes, goûter à ceux qui ne croient pas un dur châtiment, et les rétribuerons certes [d’une punition] pire que ce [que méritent] leurs méfaits.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:32: Ainsi, la rétribution des ennemis de Dieu sera le Feu où ils auront une demeure éternelle, comme punition pour avoir nié Nos versets [le Coran].
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:33: Et les mécréants diront : «Seigneur, fais-nous voir ceux des djinns et des humains qui nous ont égarés, afin que nous les placions tous sous nos pieds, pour qu’ils soient parmi les plus bas».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:34: Ceux qui disent : «Notre Seigneur est Dieu», et qui se tiennent dans le droit chemin, les Anges descendent sur eux .
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:35: Nous somme vos protecteurs dans la vie présente et dans l’au-delà; et vous y aurez ce que vos âmes désireront et ce que vous réclamerez,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:36: un lieu d’accueil de la part d’un Très Grand Pardonneur, d’un Très Miséricordieux».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:37: Et qui profère plus belles paroles que celui qui appelle à Dieu, fait bonne oeuvre et dit : «Je suis du nombre des Musulmans ? »
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:38: La bonne action et la mauvaise ne sont pas pareilles.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:39: Mais (ce privilège) n’est donné qu’à ceux qui endurent et il n’est donné qu’au possesseur d’une grâce infinie.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:40: Et si jamais le Diable t’incite (à agir autrement), alors cherche refuge auprès Dieu; c’est Lui, vraiment l’Audient, l’Omniscient.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:41: Parmi Ses merveilles, sont la nuit et le jour, le soleil et la lune : ne vous prosternez ni devant le soleil, ni devant la lune, mais prosternez-vous devant Dieu qui les a créés, si c’est Lui que vous adorez .
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:43: Et parmi Ses merveilles est que tu vois la terre humiliée (toute nue).
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:44: Ceux qui dénaturent le sens de Nos versets (le Coran) ne Nous échappent pas.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:45: Ceux qui ne croient pas au Rappel [le Coran] quand il leur parvient.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:46: Le faux ne l’atteint [d’aucune part], ni par devant ni par derrière : c’est une révélation émanant d’un Sage, Digne de louange.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:47: Il ne t’est dit que ce qui a été dit aux Messagers avant toi.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:48: Si Nous en avions fait un Coran en une langue autre que l’arabe, ils auraient dit : «Pourquoi ses versets n’ont-ils pas été exposés clairement ? quoi ? Un
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:49: non-arabe et [un Messager] arabe ? » Dis : «pour ceux qui croient, il est une guidée et une guérison».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:50: Nous avons effectivement donné à Moïse le Livre.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:51: Quiconque fait une bonne oeuvre, c’est pour son bien.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:52: A Lui revient la connaissance de l’Heure.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:53: Et ce qu’auparavant ils invoquaient les délaissera; et ils réaliseront qu’ils n’ont point d’échappatoire.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:54: L’homme ne se lasse pas d’implorer le bien.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:55: Et si nous lui faisons goûter une miséricorde de Notre part, après qu’une détresse l’ait touché, il dit certainement : «Cela m’est dû ! Et je ne pense pas que l’Heure se lèvera [un jour].
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:56: Quand Nous comblons de bienfaits l’homme, il s’esquive et s’éloigne.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:57: Dis : «Voyez-vous ? Si ceci (le Coran) émane de Dieu et qu’ensuite vous le reniez; qui se trouvera plus égaré que celui qui s’éloigne dans la dissidence ? »
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:58: Nous leur montrerons Nos signes dans l’univers et en eux-mêmes, jusqu’à ce qu’il leur devienne évident que c’est cela (le Coran), la Vérité.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 41:59: Ils sont dans le doute, n’est-ce pas, au sujet de la rencontre de leur Seigneur ? C’est Lui certes qui embrasse toute chose (par Sa science et Sa puissance).

null.verse 41:2: Eine Offenbarung von dem Gnädigen, dem Barmherzigen.
null.verse 41:3: Ein Buch, dessen Verse klar gemacht worden sind - es wird viel gelesen; es ist in fehlerloser Sprache - für Leute, die Wissen besitzen.
null.verse 41:4: Bringer froher Botschaft und Warner.
null.verse 41:5: Sie sprechen: «Unsere Herzen sind verhüllt gegen das, wozu du uns berufst, und in unseren Ohren ist Taubheit, und zwischen uns und dir ist ein Vorhang.
null.verse 41:6: Sprich: «Ich bin nur ein Mensch wie ihr.
null.verse 41:7: Die nicht die Zakat entrichten und die das Jenseits leugnen.
null.verse 41:8: Die aber glauben und gute Werke tun, die werden einen nimmer endenden Lohn erhalten.
null.verse 41:9: Sprich: «Leugnet ihr Den wirklich, Der die Erde schuf in zwei Zeiten? Und dichtet ihr Ihm Nebenbuhler an?» Er nur ist der Herr der Welten.
null.verse 41:10: Er gründete in ihr feste Berge, die sie überragen, und legte Überfluß in sie und ordnete auf ihr in richtigem Verhältnis ihre Nahrung in vier Zeiten - gleichmäßig für die Suchenden.
null.verse 41:11: Dann wandte Er Sich zum Himmel, welcher noch Nebel war, und sprach zu ihm und zu der Erde: «Kommt ihr beide, willig oder widerwillig.
null.verse 41:12: So vollendete Er sie als sieben Himmel in zwei Zeiten, und in jedem Himmel wies Er seine Aufgabe an.
null.verse 41:13: Doch wenn sie sich abkehren, so sprich: «Ich habe euch gewarnt vor einem Unheil, gleich dem Unheil, das die Àd und die Thamüd (erreichte).
null.verse 41:14: Da ihre Gesandten zu ihnen kamen von vorn und von hinten (und sprachen): «Dienet keinem denn Allah», da sprachen sie: «Hätte unser Herr es gewollt, Er würde zweifellos Engel herabgesandt haben.
null.verse 41:15: Was nun die Àd anlangt, so betrugen sie sich hoffärtig auf Erden ohne Recht und sprachen: «Wer ist stärker als wir an Macht?» Konnten sie denn nicht sehen, daß Allah, Der sie erschuf, stärker an Macht war als sie? Jedoch sie fuhren fort, Unsere Zeichen zu leugnen.
null.verse 41:16: Darum sandten Wir gegen sie einen rasenden Wind durch mehrere unheilvolle Tage, auf daß Wir sie die Strafe der Schmach in diesem Leben kosten ließen.
null.verse 41:17: Und was die Thamüd anlangt, so wiesen Wir ihnen den Weg, sie aber zogen die Blindheit dem rechten Weg vor, drum erfaßte sie das Unheil einer erniedrigenden Strafe um dessentwillen, was sie begangen.
null.verse 41:18: Und Wir erretteten jene, die glaubten und Gerechtigkeit wirkten.
null.verse 41:19: Und an dem Tage, da die Feinde Allahs zum Feuer versammelt werden allesamt, da werden sie in Gruppen geteilt werden,
null.verse 41:20: Bis daß, wenn sie es erreichen, ihre Ohren und ihre Augen und ihre Haut Zeugnis gegen sie ablegen werden von dem, was sie zu tun pflegten.
null.verse 41:21: Und sie werden zu ihrer Haut sprechen: «Warum zeugst du wider uns?» Sie wird sprechen: «Allah hat mir Rede verliehen - Er, Der einem jeden Ding Rede verleiht.
null.verse 41:22: Und ihr pflegtet (eure Sünden) nicht so zu verbergen, daß eure Ohren und eure Augen und eure Haut nicht Zeugnis ablegten wider euch; vielmehr wähntet ihr, Allah wüßte nicht vieles von dem, was ihr zu tun pflegtet.
null.verse 41:23: Und das, was ihr wähntet von eurem Herrn, hat euch ins Verderben geführt: so wurdet ihr die Verlierenden.
null.verse 41:24: Wenn sie nun auszuhalten wagen, so ist doch das Feuer ihre Wohnstatt; und wenn sie um Gnade bitten, so wird ihnen keine Gnade erwiesen werden.
null.verse 41:25: Wir hatten Gefährten für sie bestimmt, die ihnen als wohlgefällig erscheinen ließen, was vor ihnen war und was hinter ihnen war: und (so) ward der Spruch fällig gegen sie zusammen mit den Scharen der Dschinn und der Menschen, die vor ihnen hingegangen waren.
null.verse 41:26: Und die Ungläubigen sprachen: «Höret nicht auf diesen Koran, sondern macht Lärm darein, damit ihr die Oberhand behaltet.
null.verse 41:27: Aber ganz gewiß werden Wir den Ungläubigen eine strenge Strafe zu kosten geben, und ganz gewiß werden Wir ihnen ihre Schlimmsten Taten vergelten.
null.verse 41:28: Das ist der Lohn der Feinde Allahs: das Feuer.
null.verse 41:29: Und die Ungläubigen werden sagen: «Unser Herr, zeige uns jene der Dschinn und der Menschen, die uns irreführten, damit wir sie mit unseren Füßen treten, so daß sie zu den Niedrigsten gehören.
null.verse 41:30: Die aber sprechen: «Unser Herr ist Allah», und dann standhaft bleiben - zu ihnen steigen die Engel nieder (und sprechen): «Fürchtet euch nicht und seid nicht betrübt, sondern freuet euch des Paradieses, das euch verheißen ward.
null.verse 41:31: Wir sind eure Freunde in diesem Leben und im Jenseits.
null.verse 41:32: Eine Gabe von einem Vergebungsreichen, Barmherzigen.
null.verse 41:33: Und wer ist besser in der Rede als einer, der zu Allah ruft und Gutes tut und spricht: «Ich bin einer der Gottergebenen»?
null.verse 41:34: Gut und Böse sind nicht gleich.
null.verse 41:35: Aber dies wird nur denen gewährt, die standhaft sind; und keinem wird es gewährt als dem Besitzer großen Seelenadels.
null.verse 41:36: Und wenn dich ein Anreiz von Satan berührt, dann nimm deine Zuflucht bei Allah.
null.verse 41:37: Unter Seinen Zeichen sind die Nacht und der Tag und die Sonne und der Mond.
null.verse 41:38: Wenn sie sich aber in Hochmut abwenden, so lobpreisen Ihn Nacht und Tag diejenigen, die deinem Herrn nahe sind, und sie werden niemals müde.
null.verse 41:39: Und unter Seinen Zeichen ist dies: daß du die Erde leblos und verdorrt siehst, doch wenn Wir Wasser auf sie niedersenden, dann regt sie sich und schwillt.
null.verse 41:40: Diejenigen, die Unsere Zeichen entstellen, sind Uns nicht verborgen.
null.verse 41:41: Diejenigen, die nicht an die Ermahnung glauben, wenn sie zu ihnen kommt (sind die Verlierenden).
null.verse 41:42: Falschheit kann nicht daran herankommen, weder von vorn noch von hinten.
null.verse 41:43: Nichts anderes wird dir gesagt, als was schon den Gesandten vor dir gesagt ward.
null.verse 41:44: Hätten Wir es als einen Koran in einer fremden Sprache gemacht, sie hätten gesagt: «Warum sind seine Verse nicht klar gemacht worden? Wie! eine fremde Sprache und ein Araber!» Sprich: «Er ist eine Führung und eine Heilung für die Gläubigen.
null.verse 41:45: Und Wir gaben auch Moses die Schrift, doch dann entstand Uneinigkeit über sie.
null.verse 41:46: Wer das Rechte tut, es ist für seine eigene Seele; und wer Böses tut, es ist wider sie.
null.verse 41:47: Ihm allein ist das Wissen um die «Stunde» vorbehalten.
null.verse 41:48: Und alles, was sie zuvor anzurufen pflegten, wird sie im Stiche lassen, und sie werden einsehen, laß sie keine Zuflucht haben.
null.verse 41:49: Der Mensch wird nicht müde, Gutes zu erbitten; doch wenn ihn Übel berührt, dann verzweifelt er, wird hoffnungslos.
null.verse 41:50: Und wenn Wir ihn Unsere Barmherzigkeit kosten lassen, nachdem ihn ein Leid betroffen hat, so sagt er sicherlich: «Das gebührt mir; und ich glaube nicht, daß die "Stunde" kommen wird.
null.verse 41:51: Wenn Wir dem Menschen Gnade erweisen, dann kehrt er sich ab und geht seitwärts; doch wenn ihn Übel berührt, siehe, dann beginnt er lange, lange Gebete zu sprechen.
null.verse 41:52: Sprich: «Besinnt euch: Wenn es von Allah ist und ihr glaubt nicht daran - wer ist irrender als einer, der weit weg ist?»
null.verse 41:53: Bald werden Wir sie Unsere Zeichen sehen lassen überall auf Erden und an ihnen selbst, bis ihnen deutlich wird, daß es die Wahrheit ist.
null.verse 41:54: Höret! sie sind im Zweifel über die Begegnung mit ihrem Herrn.
